TopicTitle: Cheap and high capacity replacement disk

Articles.Content: My secondary 250 GB drive just potentially died right now, so do any one of you know a cheap high capacity disk that could be used for replacing this disk?
I don think you can buy less then 1TB these days, just get whatever you can =>
First of all, you need to define "cheap".

Best value you're going to find will probably be a 2TB drive, which will run you US$90-120. That's the best $/GB deal I've managed to find.

500GB is just about the smallest, new-in-box drive you're likely to find and will cost you ~us$50-70. This is a terrible bargain when you can get 4x the capacity for ~1.5x the price, but if funds are limited...

=Smidge=

Some important things:

what was the dead HDD's slot?

PCI Express X2/4/8/16?

or SATA #Gb/s

and what was the form factor?
